DOC.brief_title: Comparison Between Lidocaine , Dexmedetomidine , Their Combined Infusion Subjects Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Graft
DOC.detailed_description: Lidocaine report antiarrhythmic myocardial protective effect . A previous study report low-dose lidocaine infusion decrease incidence ventricular fibrillation tachycardia first 24 hour coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) . A recent study also report lidocaine infusion CABG could decrease myocardial injury measure CK-MB Troponin-I blood level . Dexmedetomidine alpha-2 agonist reduces sympathetic tone neuroendocrine stress response . Dexmedetomidine report cardioprotective effect previous animal study . However , clinical study evaluate cardioprotective effect dexmedetomidine . Therefore , try evaluate compare antiarrhythmic myocardial protective effect lidocaine , dexmedetomidine , combine infusion subject undergoing coronary artery bypass graft .
